issue.title: Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

labels.name: :wave: request review
labels.description: Review required

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: :eagle: team-falcon
labels.description: Team Falcon Label

issue.body:
# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents


**Pull Request status**

# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:

- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents

# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents

issue.title: CLI with flag -s "commit" -w "kyma-repo location" wipes eveything from kyma-repo location

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: area/cli
labels.description: Related to all activities around CLI

labels.name: priority/critical
labels.description: Priority indication

issue.body:
**Description**
When you want to deploy kyma from commit, the workspace location is cleaned with ci mode, the workspace directory is wiped.
I don't know why the directory is wiped if CLI create directory with commit ID and then put kyma resources into newly created repository

**Expected result**
Kyma CLI shouldn't wipe the whole directory

**Actual result**
Kyma CLI clean all in workspace directory

**Steps to reproduce**
```
mkdir /tmp/test
touch /tmp/test/README.md
kyma deploy -s a318bcac41c64c4c5f79465ad257378fed17a945 -w /tmp/test --ci
```
**Troubleshooting**

<!-- Describe the steps you have already taken to solve the issue. -->

issue.title: Make `eventing-nats-secret` only accessible for admin roles.

labels.name: area/security
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to security

labels.name: area/eventing
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to eventing

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
-->

**Description**

in Kyma eventing the `nats-server` can now be accessed with `system account` privileges. The required credentials to do so can be found in in the Secret [`eventing-nats-secret`](https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/blob/main/resources/eventing/charts/nats/templates/secret.yaml). 
```bash
kubectl get secrets -n kyma-system eventing-nats-secret -oyaml
```
To increase security, this resource should only be accessible for admin cluster roles and/or excluded for other roles.

**Reasons**

increased security.

**Attachments**

here is an overview of all the resources of interest that interact with the secret and thus need access. Note that the monitoring by the `config-reloader` is currently only [a planned feature](https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/issues/15377).

```mermaid
flowchart
subgraph kymasystem[namespace: kyma-system]
	subgraph podnats[pod: eventing-nats-n]
		containernatsserver[container: nats-server]
		containerconfigreloader[container: config-reloader]
	end
	secret[secret: eventing-nats-server]
end

containernatsserver--mounts-->secret

containerconfigreloader--watches-->secret

containerconfigreloader--triggers reload-->containernatsserver
```

issue.title: Set logging level in externalplugins.

labels.name: area/ci
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to CI related topics

labels.name: area/prow
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to prow configuration

issue.body:
Externalplugin module doesn't support setting logging level so we can't add debug logging statements which can. be used only for troubleshooting.

Our console logger allow to set logging level.
We need to add this feature to gcp logging logger.
We need to change default externalplugin logger to version with support for setting logging level.
We need to add debug logging statements for module.

https://github.com/kyma-project/test-infra/blob/eca8489ff9d211b2cf84cdbeec9e34413fca186a/development/prow/externalplugin/externalplugin.go#L80

issue.body:

**Description**

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of the feature. -->
[Kubernetes external secrets](https://github.com/external-secrets/kubernetes-external-secrets) is deprecated

**Acceptance Criteria**

<!-- Describe quickly what criteria should be met in order to consider it closed -->
- [ ] replace it with [External Secrets Operator](https://github.com/external-secrets/external-secrets) chart if possible
    - [ ] check if https://github.com/external-secrets/kes-to-eso would help

issue.title: Use usernames required for the communication channel.

labels.name: area/ci
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to CI related topics

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
-->

**Description**

When sending message from any automated process I would like to use a username which is valid for the communication channel I use. This will allow me to use @mentions and send messages to desired user if that's needed. I would like to have one service where I could query about username information.

**Reasons**

At present we use tools which have separate user databases thus use different usernames. Bots are not able to match usernames between different systems.

issue.title: Tracking changes in permissions

labels.name: area/security
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to security

labels.name: area/ci
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to CI related topics

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
-->

**Description**

Every time we change a permissions schema, in any system such change should be reflected in an issue. Any change of permissions schema/policy must be reviewed and discussed with the team to confirm changes. If permissions change was introduced as a part of failure or bug fixing it must be reviewed after the issue is fixed. The issue must contain detailed description of changes in policy/schema to make possible reverting introduced changes. Any post change issues for permissions changes must be added to the backlog with highest priority so it's evaluated on next planning. Issues should not be public visible to not reveal possible security holes. They should be put in our team project as a draft issues to keep all tasks in one place.

Can we implement some tool which can detect changes in permissions?
Should we run permissions audit periodically?

**Reasons**

This requirements are meant to secure us from granting excessive permissions and to stick to the best practises about permission levels.

issue.body:
**Description**
Add business logic for the formation assignment async API

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- updating formation assignment state and configuration with the data provided through the API
- generate formation assignment notifications("normal" and "reverse") based on formation assignment ID
- process/send the newly generated notifications
- unit tests + fixing/updating fixtures
- e2e tests

**Related issue(s)**
- https://github.com/kyma-incubator/compass/pull/2712

**Pull Request status**
- [ ] Implementation
- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] Integration tests
- [ ] `chart/compass/values.yaml` is updated <!-- in case of code changes in the `components` or `tests` directories -->
- [ ] Mocks are regenerated, using the automated script

issue.body:
**Description**
Add business logic for the formation assignment async API

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- updating formation assignment state and configuration with the data provided through the API
- generate formation assignment notifications("normal" and "reverse") based on formation assignment ID
- process/send the newly generated notifications
- unit tests + fixing/updating fixtures
- e2e tests

pull_request.title: Change the returned configuration value
pull_request.body:
<!--   Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the pull request:
1. Follow contributing guidelines, templates, the recommended Git workflow, and any related documentation.
2. Read and submit the required Contributor Licence Agreements (https://github.com/kyma-project/community/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#agreements-and-licenses).
3. Test your changes and attach their results to the pull request.
4. Update the relevant documentation.
-->

**Description**
Currently, if in the DB the formation assignment has <null> in the 'value' column the GQL returns "null". But we want the GQL to return an empty string.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- GQL to return an empty string if the value of an FA is <null> in the DB.

**Pull Request status**
<!-- Feel free to construct the checklist with whatever items seem most reasonable for your change. You could disassemble the Implementation part to even smaller separate checklist items if you're working on something big for example. -->

- [x] [N/A] `chart/compass/values.yaml` is updated <!-- in case of code changes in the `components` or `tests` directories -->

labels.name: :wave: request review

labels.description: Team Falcon Label

issue.body:
# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents

# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents

labels.name: :wave: request review

labels.name: size/XXL
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: :eagle: team-falcon
labels.description: Team Falcon Label

issue.body:
# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents


**Pull Request status**

issue.title: CLI with flag -s "commit" -w "kyma-repo location" wipes eveything from kyma-repo location

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: area/cli
labels.description: Related to all activities around CLI

labels.name: priority/critical
labels.description: Priority indication

issue.body:
**Description**
When you want to deploy kyma from commit, the workspace location is cleaned with ci mode, the workspace directory is wiped.
I don't know why the directory is wiped if CLI create directory with commit ID and then put kyma resources into newly created repository

**Expected result**
Kyma CLI shouldn't wipe the whole directory

**Actual result**
Kyma CLI clean all in workspace directory

**Steps to reproduce**
```
mkdir /tmp/test
touch /tmp/test/README.md
kyma deploy -s a318bcac41c64c4c5f79465ad257378fed17a945 -w /tmp/test --ci
```
**Troubleshooting**

<!-- Describe the steps you have already taken to solve the issue. -->

comment.body:
This issue or PR has been automatically marked as stale due to the lack of recent activity.
Thank you for your contributions.

This bot triages issues and PRs according to the following rules:
- After 60d of inactivity, `lifecycle/stale` is applied
- After 7d of inactivity since `lifecycle/stale` was applied, the issue is closed

You can:
- Mark this issue or PR as fresh with `/remove-lifecycle stale`
- Close this issue or PR with `/close`

If you think that I work incorrectly, kindly [raise an issue](https://github.com/kyma-project/test-infra/issues/new/choose) with the problem.

/lifecycle stale

issue.title: Make `eventing-nats-secret` only accessible for admin roles.

labels.name: area/security
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to security

labels.name: area/eventing
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to eventing

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
-->

**Description**

in Kyma eventing the `nats-server` can now be accessed with `system account` privileges. The required credentials to do so can be found in in the Secret [`eventing-nats-secret`](https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/blob/main/resources/eventing/charts/nats/templates/secret.yaml). 
```bash
kubectl get secrets -n kyma-system eventing-nats-secret -oyaml
```
To increase security, this resource should only be accessible for admin cluster roles and/or excluded for other roles.

**Reasons**

increased security.

**Attachments**

here is an overview of all the resources of interest that interact with the secret and thus need access. Note that the monitoring by the `config-reloader` is currently only [a planned feature](https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/issues/15377).

```mermaid
flowchart
subgraph kymasystem[namespace: kyma-system]
	subgraph podnats[pod: eventing-nats-n]
		containernatsserver[container: nats-server]
		containerconfigreloader[container: config-reloader]
	end
	secret[secret: eventing-nats-server]
end

containernatsserver--mounts-->secret

containerconfigreloader--watches-->secret

containerconfigreloader--triggers reload-->containernatsserver
```

**Description**

When sending message from any automated process I would like to use a username which is valid for the communication channel I use. This will allow me to use @mentions and send messages to desired user if that's needed. I would like to have one service where I could query about username information.

**Reasons**

At present we use tools which have separate user databases thus use different usernames. Bots are not able to match usernames between different systems.

issue.title: Tracking changes in permissions

labels.name: area/security
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to security

labels.name: area/ci
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to CI related topics

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
-->

**Description**

Every time we change a permissions schema, in any system such change should be reflected in an issue. Any change of permissions schema/policy must be reviewed and discussed with the team to confirm changes. If permissions change was introduced as a part of failure or bug fixing it must be reviewed after the issue is fixed. The issue must contain detailed description of changes in policy/schema to make possible reverting introduced changes. Any post change issues for permissions changes must be added to the backlog with highest priority so it's evaluated on next planning. Issues should not be public visible to not reveal possible security holes. They should be put in our team project as a draft issues to keep all tasks in one place.

Can we implement some tool which can detect changes in permissions?
Should we run permissions audit periodically?

**Reasons**

This requirements are meant to secure us from granting excessive permissions and to stick to the best practises about permission levels.

labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: do-not-merge/hold
labels.description: Indicates that a PR should not merge because someone has issued a /hold command.

labels.name: :t-rex: team-raptor
labels.description: Team Raptor Label

issue.body:
**Description**
Add business logic for the formation assignment async API

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- updating formation assignment state and configuration with the data provided through the API
- generate formation assignment notifications("normal" and "reverse") based on formation assignment ID
- process/send the newly generated notifications
- unit tests + fixing/updating fixtures
- e2e tests

**Related issue(s)**
- https://github.com/kyma-incubator/compass/pull/2712

**Pull Request status**
- [ ] Implementation
- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] Integration tests
- [ ] `chart/compass/values.yaml` is updated <!-- in case of code changes in the `components` or `tests` directories -->
- [ ] Mocks are regenerated, using the automated script

issue.body:
**Description**
Add business logic for the formation assignment async API

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- updating formation assignment state and configuration with the data provided through the API
- generate formation assignment notifications("normal" and "reverse") based on formation assignment ID
- process/send the newly generated notifications
- unit tests + fixing/updating fixtures
- e2e tests

**Related issue(s)**
- https://github.com/kyma-incubator/compass/pull/2712

- [ ] Unit tests
- [ ] Integration tests
- [ ] `chart/compass/values.yaml` is updated <!-- in case of code changes in the `components` or `tests` directories -->
- [ ] Mocks are regenerated, using the automated script

pull_request.title: Change the returned configuration value
pull_request.body:
<!--   Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the pull request:
1. Follow contributing guidelines, templates, the recommended Git workflow, and any related documentation.
2. Read and submit the required Contributor Licence Agreements (https://github.com/kyma-project/community/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#agreements-and-licenses).
3. Test your changes and attach their results to the pull request.
4. Update the relevant documentation.
-->

**Description**
Currently, if in the DB the formation assignment has <null> in the 'value' column the GQL returns "null". But we want the GQL to return an empty string.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- GQL to return an empty string if the value of an FA is <null> in the DB.

<!-- Feel free to construct the checklist with whatever items seem most reasonable for your change. You could disassemble the Implementation part to even smaller separate checklist items if you're working on something big for example. issue.body:
# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents

# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents

# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents

issue.body:
# Decouple and parallelize ORD specification fetching

**Description**

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- decouple the ORD specification fetching from the API and Event resource processing
- execute specification fetching as the very last thing in the ord aggregation process
- execute the specification fetching process in parallel to ensure faster processing of ord documents


**Pull Request status**

issue.title: CLI with flag -s "commit" -w "kyma-repo location" wipes eveything from kyma-repo location

labels.name: kind/bug
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.

labels.name: area/cli
labels.description: Related to all activities around CLI

labels.name: priority/critical
labels.description: Priority indication

issue.body:
**Description**
When you want to deploy kyma from commit, the workspace location is cleaned with ci mode, the workspace directory is wiped.
I don't know why the directory is wiped if CLI create directory with commit ID and then put kyma resources into newly created repository

**Expected result**
Kyma CLI shouldn't wipe the whole directory

**Actual result**
Kyma CLI clean all in workspace directory

**Steps to reproduce**
```
mkdir /tmp/test
touch /tmp/test/README.md
kyma deploy -s a318bcac41c64c4c5f79465ad257378fed17a945 -w /tmp/test --ci
```

issue.title: Make `eventing-nats-secret` only accessible for admin roles.

labels.name: area/security
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to security

labels.name: area/eventing
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to eventing

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
-->

**Description**

in Kyma eventing the `nats-server` can now be accessed with `system account` privileges. The required credentials to do so can be found in in the Secret [`eventing-nats-secret`](https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/blob/main/resources/eventing/charts/nats/templates/secret.yaml). 
```bash
kubectl get secrets -n kyma-system eventing-nats-secret -oyaml
```
To increase security, this resource should only be accessible for admin cluster roles and/or excluded for other roles.

**Reasons**

increased security.

**Attachments**

here is an overview of all the resources of interest that interact with the secret and thus need access. Note that the monitoring by the `config-reloader` is currently only [a planned feature](https://github.com/kyma-project/kyma/issues/15377).

```mermaid
flowchart
subgraph kymasystem[namespace: kyma-system]
	subgraph podnats[pod: eventing-nats-n]
		containernatsserver[container: nats-server]
		containerconfigreloader[container: config-reloader]
	end
	secret[secret: eventing-nats-server]
end

containernatsserver--mounts-->secret

containerconfigreloader--watches-->secret

containerconfigreloader--triggers reload-->containernatsserver
```

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
-->

**Description**

When sending message from any automated process I would like to use a username which is valid for the communication channel I use. This will allow me to use @mentions and send messages to desired user if that's needed. I would like to have one service where I could query about username information.

**Reasons**

At present we use tools which have separate user databases thus use different usernames. Bots are not able to match usernames between different systems.

issue.title: Tracking changes in permissions

labels.name: area/security
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to security

labels.name: area/ci
labels.description: Issues or PRs related to CI related topics

labels.name: kind/feature
labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

issue.body:
<!-- Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the issue:
1. Search open and closed issues for duplicates.
2. Read the contributing guidelines.
-->

**Description**

Every time we change a permissions schema, in any system such change should be reflected in an issue. Any change of permissions schema/policy must be reviewed and discussed with the team to confirm changes. If permissions change was introduced as a part of failure or bug fixing it must be reviewed after the issue is fixed. The issue must contain detailed description of changes in policy/schema to make possible reverting introduced changes. Any post change issues for permissions changes must be added to the backlog with highest priority so it's evaluated on next planning. Issues should not be public visible to not reveal possible security holes. They should be put in our team project as a draft issues to keep all tasks in one place.

Can we implement some tool which can detect changes in permissions?
Should we run permissions audit periodically?

**Reasons**

This requirements are meant to secure us from granting excessive permissions and to stick to the best practises about permission levels.

issue.body:
**Description**
Add business logic for the formation assignment async API

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- updating formation assignment state and configuration with the data provided through the API
- generate formation assignment notifications("normal" and "reverse") based on formation assignment ID
- process/send the newly generated notifications
- unit tests + fixing/updating fixtures
- e2e tests

issue.body:
**Description**
Add business logic for the formation assignment async API

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- updating formation assignment state and configuration with the data provided through the API
- generate formation assignment notifications("normal" and "reverse") based on formation assignment ID
- process/send the newly generated notifications
- unit tests + fixing/updating fixtures
- e2e tests

pull_request.title: Change the returned configuration value
pull_request.body:
<!--   Thank you for your contribution. Before you submit the pull request:
1. Follow contributing guidelines, templates, the recommended Git workflow, and any related documentation.
2. Read and submit the required Contributor Licence Agreements (https://github.com/kyma-project/community/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#agreements-and-licenses).
3. Test your changes and attach their results to the pull request.
4. Update the relevant documentation.
-->

**Description**
Currently, if in the DB the formation assignment has <null> in the 'value' column the GQL returns "null". But we want the GQL to return an empty string.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- GQL to return an empty string if the value of an FA is <null> in the DB.

**Description**
Currently, if in the DB the formation assignment has <null> in the 'value' column the GQL returns "null". But we want the GQL to return an empty string.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- GQL to return an empty string if the value of an FA is <null> in the DB.
